name: FOXP2
description: Speech quirks, language genius, or silence — all tied to this gene.
summary: FOXP2 is essential for proper development of speech and language. Mutations here have been linked to speech disorders and linguistic ability.

name: DEC2
description: Some people sleep only 4 hours. Thank DEC2.
summary: DEC2 affects circadian rhythm and sleep length. Some rare mutations allow individuals to thrive on significantly less sleep.

name: ELN
description: The trust-too-easily gene — missing this may explain Williams Syndrome.
summary: ELN codes for elastin, a protein critical to connective tissues. Its deletion is linked to the developmental disorder Williams Syndrome.

name: DRD4
description: Risk? Adventure? This dopamine gene’s got you covered.
summary: DRD4 is linked to novelty-seeking behavior and dopamine signaling. Variants have been studied in relation to ADHD, addiction, and personality traits.

name: MAOA
description: Sometimes called the warrior gene — and it's controversial.
summary: MAOA affects the breakdown of neurotransmitters like serotonin and dopamine. Certain variants have been studied for links to impulsivity and aggression.

name: ACTN3
description: The sprint gene — elite athletes often have this mutation.
summary: ACTN3 is associated with fast-twitch muscle fibers. A common mutation deactivates it, but this may actually benefit endurance athletes.

name: SLC6A4
description: Affects serotonin reuptake — could influence anxiety or resilience.
summary: SLC6A4 encodes the serotonin transporter. Its variants are studied for their impact on mood regulation and mental health.
